description.narrative: Output 2.3: Adolescent friendly SRH & HIVvide gender-sensitive and adolescent-friendly reproductive health services, including HIV services., which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Hiv Prevention, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 02: Improved and equitable use of proven HIV prevention and treatment interventions by children, pregnant women and adolescents (boys & girls), by 2015.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF FINANCE AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT

sector.narrative: HIV testing including self testing and counselling in adolescents
Support Policy and guidance developments and address barriers to accessing HIV services by adolescents including gender mainstreaming

title.narrative: Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.3: Adolescent friendly SRH & HIVvide gender-sensitive and adolescent-friendly reproductive health services, including HIVservices.
Proportion of health facilities that are providing gender-sensitive and adolescent-friendly reproductive health services

Proportion of health facilities with functional gender-sensitive and adolescent friendly reproductive health services, including HIV, have at least one health professional with ASRH skills, & are fully equipped and supplied regularly monitored to provide these services by 2015
